relation: Select an existing Oracle Service Bus configuration and an import destination (project or folder).
Enter the fully qualified name of a ZIP file to import, or click Browse to select it.

To work around this issue, define a JMS foreign server and reference that foreign server in the URI. For more information about transport-level security, see "Configuring Transport-Level Security" in the Oracle Fusion Middleware Developer's Guide for Oracle Service Bus at http://www.oracle.com/pls/as111170/lookup?id=OSBDV1557., 183001=For configuration properties, see Section 4.11.28, "Routing Action Properties.", 204323=Section 4.11.23, "Replace Action Properties", 472738=2031354 – Errors setting the security context, 201861=Section 4.11.13, "Message Flow Properties - Comment", 401273=Section 4.22.32, "Split-Join Wizard - Specify Operations", 191984=For configuration properties, see Section 4.11.24, "Reply Action Properties.", 203795=Section 4.11.18, "Pipeline Pair Node Properties", 148773=Specify a customization file or click Browse, locate the file, then click Open. For information on customization, see "Creating Customization Files" in the Oracle Fusion Middleware Administrator's Guide for Oracle Service Bus at http://www.oracle.com/pls/as111170/lookup?id=OSBAG1360., 106636=For information, see "Securing Oracle Service Bus with Oracle Web Services Manager" in the Oracle Fusion Middleware Developer's Guide for Oracle Service Bus at http://www.oracle.com/pls/as111170/lookup?id=OSBDV1681., 244511=Return Parameter as Reference: This option makes the return value of a Java Callout invocation a <java-content ref="jcid"> reference element regardless of its actual type, where jcid is the key to the object in the pipeline object repository. In the Result value field, enter the name of the variable to contain the java-content reference. This option lets you work with a referenced object in the message flow in addition to the pipeline XML for providing passthrough, performing message enrichment with Java Callout and inline actions, or performing message transformation between Java and non-Java transports. For more information, see "Sending and Receiving Java Objects in Messages" in the Oracle Fusion Middleware Developer's Guide for Oracle Service Bus at http://www.oracle.com/pls/as111170/lookup?id=OSBDV1874., 399413=Section 4.22.13, "Re-Raise Error Properties", 199537=For configuration properties, see Section 4.11.12, "Log Action Properties.", 410698=For configuration properties, see Section 4.22.20, "Insert Properties.", 399312=Section 4.22.12, "Repeat Until Properties", 399892=Section 4.22.18, "Copy Properties", 192486=For configuration properties, see Section 4.11.32, "Skip Action Properties.", 307677=See Section 4.11.28, "Routing Action Properties.", 342364=For more information, see "UDDI" in the Oracle Fusion Middleware Administrator's Guide for Oracle Service Bus at http://www.oracle.com/pls/as111170/lookup?id=OSBAG392., 20371=Java - Select this option if a Java Object is being sent in the request. The JMS transport is used for Java Object messages. textBeforeTable: Table 4-26 Configuration ZIP Import Use this page to select a ZIP file with resources to import and an import destination. 4.7.3 Import Wizard - Config ZIP Import - Load Resources Page Select this check box to preserve PKI credentials in service key providers, user name and passwords in service accounts, and user name and password credentials in SMTP servers, JNDI providers, and UDDI registries. Preserve credentials (user name and password) Select this check box to preserve the security configuration (excluding access control policies) and the references to the WS-Policies bound directly to the service (instead of bound to the WSDL). Preserve security and policy settings Select this check box when you are re-importing a resource but want to preserve environment variable values in the existing resource. Preserve environment variable values Enter the password that was used to encrypt the data. Passphrase Select this check box if you are importing a resource JAR file and want to ensure that all its associated resources are imported.
textAfterTable: 4.7.4 Import Wizard - Config ZIP Import - Review Resources Page Use this page to select the objects you want to import. Clear the check boxes next to any resources that you do not want to include in this import. Table 4-27 Configuration ZIP Import Options Option Description Resource The name of the project and resource. Operation Create or update. The operation that will be performed on the resource. File Name The file name of the resource, including the file extension. 4.7.5 Import Wizard - URL Import - Load Resources Page Use this page to import resources such as WSDLs or XML schemas that are available on the Web. You can import them, along with all their dependents, by specifying the URL of the root resource. Table 4-28 URL Import Options
